title: Commending Pastor Paul B. Milholland of Trinity Lutheran Church in Long Island City/Astoria, upon the occasion of his Pastoral Installation
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending Pastor Paul B. Milholland of Trinity
Lutheran Church in Long Island City/Astoria, upon the  occasion  of  his
Pastoral Installation, celebrated on Sunday, September 26, 2010

WHEREAS,  The  character and richness of religious and community life in
this noble Empire State is nourished and fulfilled through the  faithful
concern  and  selfless devotion of those who would commit their energies
and purpose to the ministry of others; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to bring full recog-
nition and just tribute to those individuals who distinguish  themselves
and the ministry through their unremitting commitment and preeminence of
service; and
  WHEREAS,  This Legislative Body is justly proud to commend Pastor Paul
B.  Milholland of Trinity Lutheran Church in Long  Island  City/Astoria,
upon the occasion of his Pastoral Installation; and
  WHEREAS, Pastor Paul Milholland became the spiritual leader of Trinity
Lutheran  Church on May 9, 2010; the son of a Lutheran minister, he is a
native of North Carolina, and served parishes in North Carolina,  Virgi-
nia,  and Florida prior to coming to New York; for the past 8 1/2 years,
he served as pastor of St. John's Lutheran of  Lindenhurst,  in  Western
Suffolk County; and
  WHEREAS,  Pastor  Paul Milholland was educated at Lenoir-Rhyne College
in North Carolina, where he received a Bachelor of Arts in Religion with
significant course work in Sociology and Theater Arts; he  received  his
Master of Divinity from the Lutheran Theological Seminary at Gettysburg,
Pennsylvania, with special emphasis in Luther studies and Ecumenism; and
  WHEREAS,  Pastor  Milholland  engaged  in  Clinical Pastoral Education
(hospital chaplaincy training) at the Lutheran  Medical  Center  in  the
Sunset  Park  area  of  Brooklyn,  New  York;  although  no  degree  was
conferred, he also took coursework at the Presbyterian School of  Chris-
tian Education in Virginia; and
  WHEREAS,  In  1982  and 1983, Pastor Milholland became acquainted with
the New York area when he served as a Youth Staffer for the Metropolitan
New York Synod of the Lutheran Church in America; in this  capacity,  he
provided  leadership  to  the  synod's youth organization, led retreats,
developed youth groups, trained adults working with  youth,  and  helped
plan several region-wide youth events; and
  WHEREAS, Pastor Paul Milholland has written and directed several plays
for children, young people, and adults, which have been performed in his
parishes;  he enjoys retreats, conferences, as well as summer camp expe-
riences for people of all ages; and
  WHEREAS, Pastor Milholland has brought to his ministry an overwhelming
spirit of charity and compassion, acting from vision  and  enlightenment
in  conducting  his  administrative  and  spiritual duties, while always
displaying the highest standards of personal and professional  integrity
and dedication; and
  WHEREAS, This distinguished man of God has always given enlightenment,
guidance  and  wisdom to the many entrusted to his care and has adminis-
tered abundantly and unstintingly to the spiritual and corporal needs of
all; and
  WHEREAS, With him throughout has been his son, Kell, who feels  privi-
leged to be a part of his life and rejoices in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body that when a person
of such noble aims and accomplishments is brought to our attention it is
appropriate to publicly and jubilantly proclaim and commend  that  indi-
vidual for the edification of others; now, therefore, be it

  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commend Pastor Paul B. Milholland of Trinity  Lutheran  Church  in  Long
Island  City/Astoria,  upon  the  occasion of his Pastoral Installation,
celebrated on Sunday, September 26, 2010,  noting  his  unremitting  and
compassionate  faith  and  his  exemplary  service  to God, man, and his
community, and extending to him the heartfelt best wishes of this Legis-
lative Body for a future of purposeful success and well-being; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Pastor Paul B. Milholland.
